alert.note: Alert for Southern Gila County, Tonto National Forest Foothills (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 18 at 2:18PM MST until May 20 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTH-CENTRAL ARIZONA INCLUDING SOUTHERN GILA COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds, low relative humidity and very high fire danger, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Southern Gila County/Tonto National Forest Foothills. * TIMING...Noon to 8 pm Friday. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts 30 to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Fuels are very dry and fire danger is very high. These conditions combined with low relative humidity and strong winds will lead to widespread hazardous fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials and fire crews in the field of this fire weather watch.

area.areaDesc: Southern Gila County, Tonto National Forest Foothills
